task_summary: Robot, already holding a bread, approaches a small white plate, lowers until contact, releases the bread onto the plate, and retreats.

task_long_description.overview: The scene shows a PR2 gripper operating over a green mat with a small white plate. A bread-like item is near the gripper and ends centered on the plate. The behavior coordinates perception of the plate, a controlled approach from above, gentle lowering until contact with the dish, release with an appropriate gripper width, and a safe retreat. Constraints include stable alignment to avoid knocking the plate and a gentle touchdown before opening the gripper to prevent bouncing.
preconditions: Bread is already in the gripper
Workspace is clear; plate is on the mat
Robot has calibrated transforms for camera/arm
stepwise_plan: Verify the bread is in the gripper.
Move to a pre-place pose above the plate.
Lower slowly until contact is detected.
Open gripper to release the bread onto the plate.
success_criteria: Bread rests on the plate without tipping or rolling
No collision with plate rim during approach
Gripper retreats clear of the object and plate
failure_and_recovery: Plate not detected -> repeat perception or scan area
Release failure (bread stuck) -> reopen gripper and retreat slightly, then retry placement
Premature contact -> retreat and re-approach with smaller tolerance
task_long_description.termination: Tree succeeds when the bread is released on the plate and the arm retreats to a safe pose.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks that the bread is held before starting placement.
Moves the TCP to a pre-place pose above the plate.
Refines lateral alignment over the plate with tight tolerance.
Descends slowly until contact with the plate is detected.
Opens the gripper to release the bread.
Backs away to a safe clearance pose.

failure_modes: Misalignment causing bread to hit plate rim
Bread adheres to fingertip and doesnâ€™t drop
recovery_strategy: Re-run DetectObject or perform a scan pattern
Open/close cycle then attempt release again
Retreat and retry lowering with smaller depth
assumptions: Frames indicate a placement sequence (bread ends on plate). Instruction says 'picking a bread'; we prioritized visual evidence and implemented a place behavior.
Bread is already grasped at episode start.

expected_success_criteria: Bread centered on plate; no tipping; arm clear at end
